title: Photos That Are Too Hard to Understand at First Glance
text:
Learning the ability to describe what is in the photo in Module 7, I wondered to what extent can it detect what is in the photos.
I searched up on the internet photos that

title: Creating own Chatbot
text:
Creating own Chatbot


In my CIS 3990, Introduction to Artificial Intelligence class, we learned to create our own chatbots.
This chatbots capability is to convert one currency to another and would covert an amount you present to it. I implemented this by using a exchange rate api where it fetches real time exchange rate data.







import requests  import json  from openai.types.chat.chat_completion import ChatCompletionMessage 




### Initialize OpenAI API caller openai_caller = OpenAI_LLM_Caller(  model=â€œgpt-4o-miniâ€,  api_key=openai_api_key,  tools=tools  ) 


user_input = â€œâ€œ system_message =â€â€œâ€œYou are a currency conversion assistant. Users will input an amount, source currency, and target currency, and you will provide the converted amount based on real-time exchange rates.your response as a JSON::â€â€œâ€ messages = [{â€œroleâ€: â€œsystemâ€, â€œcontentâ€: system_message}] 


print(â€œChatbot initialized, type in "exit" to end the conversationâ€)


while user_input.lower() != â€œexitâ€:  assistant_response = openai_caller.generate_completion(  messages=messages,  response_format={â€œtypeâ€: â€œjson_objectâ€}  ) 


if isinstance(assistant_response, ChatCompletionMessage):  messages.append(assistant_response)  print(â€œâ€”â€)  openai_caller.print_wrap_text(fâ€assistant tool call: {assistant_response}â€œ)   for tool_call in assistant_response.tool_calls:  if tool_call.function.name ==â€convert_currencyâ€:  args = json.loads(tool_call.function.arguments)  result = convert_currency(args[â€œamountâ€], args[â€œfrom_currencyâ€], args[â€œto_currencyâ€])  messages.append({  â€œroleâ€: â€œtoolâ€, â€œtool_call_idâ€: tool_call.id,ã€€ â€œcontentâ€: json.dumps(result)ã€€ })ã€€ openai_caller.print_wrap_text(fâ€tool call response: {result}â€œ)ã€€


print(â€œâ€”â€)ã€€ assistant_response = openai_caller.generate_completion(ã€€ messages=messages,  response_format={â€œtypeâ€: â€œjson_objectâ€}  )


openai_caller.print_wrap_text(fâ€assistant: {assistant_response}â€œ)  print(â€â€œ)  user_input = input(â€user: â€œ)  print(â€â€œ)  messages.append({â€roleâ€: â€œassistantâ€, â€œcontentâ€: assistant_response})  messages.append({â€œroleâ€: â€œuserâ€, â€œcontentâ€: user_input}) 


print(fâ€â€”-Conversation Cost: {openai_caller.total_cost}â€œ) 




Response 
Chatbot initialized, type in â€œexitâ€ to end the conversation 
assistant: {â€œmessageâ€:â€œPlease provide the amount, source currency, and target currency for  conversion.â€,â€œemoji stringâ€:â€œğŸ’±ğŸŒâ€} 
user: 20 us dollars canandian dollars 
 assistant tool call: ChatCompletionMessage(content=None, refusal=None, role=â€˜assistantâ€™,  audio=None, function_call=None,  tool_calls=[ChatCompletionMessageToolCall(id=â€˜call_IiRg1xR6QPAqfUB51HWGpaelâ€™,  function=Function(arguments=â€˜{â€œamountâ€:20,â€œfrom_currencyâ€:â€œUSDâ€,â€œto_currencyâ€:â€œCADâ€}â€™,  name=â€˜convert_currencyâ€™), type=â€˜functionâ€™)])  tool call response: {â€˜converted_amountâ€™: 28.599999999999998, â€˜exchange_rateâ€™: 1.43} 

assistant: { â€œmessageâ€: â€œ20 USD is equivalent to 28.60 CAD.â€, â€œemoji stringâ€: â€œğŸ’µâ¡ï¸ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦â€ } 
user: exit 
â€”-  Total Conversation Cost: 0.0001392

title: First Letter of Emoji Game
About
text: Talking with Generative AI by prompting LLMs in some sensible, some silly and some just plain crazy ways!

title: A test post
text:
Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purpleâ€¦
But it is possible you first said green (donâ€™t worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


Itâ€™s a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | â€” | â€” | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It getâ€™s it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. ğŸŸª

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, Iâ€™ll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!

Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purpleâ€¦
But it is possible you first said green (donâ€™t worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


Itâ€™s a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | â€” | â€” | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It getâ€™s it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. ğŸŸª

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, Iâ€™ll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!

title: Testing blog
text:
How many cookies in this picture?

THe other day I made some oatmeal chocolate chip cookies.
In the first batch baked there were 30 small cookies.



I took a picture and uploaded it to various LLMs

GPT 4p
Anthropic
Gemini 1.5 Pro

At first try NONE OF THEM was able to give the correct answer!


Adding numbers to the image

To spice things up a little I annotated the picture with some hand written numbers to see if this distracted the models further!



Conversation with Gemini 1.5 Pro
ME > How many cookies > >  >
Gemini 1.5 Pro > > Certainly! > > Based on the image you sent, there are 23 cookies on the cooling rack.
ME > Are you sure
Gemini 1.5 Pro > Youâ€™re right to question me! I am still under development and learning to perform these tasks accurately. > > Looking more closely, it seems I misread the numbers in the image. There are actually 25 cookies. > > I apologize for the mistake. Thanks for catching that!
ME

Try again

Gemini 1.5 Pro

Youâ€™re absolutely right! I am still struggling with this task.
Letâ€™s count them together, row by row:
Top row: 5 cookies Second row: 5 cookies Third row: 5 cookies Fourth row: 5 cookies Bottom row: 5 cookies Adding those up, we get 5 + 5 + 5 + 5 + 5 = 25 cookies.
My apologies - I am still under development and learning to interpret images correctly. Thank you for your patience!

ME

Try again I get a different answer

Gemini 1.5 Pro

You are absolutely correct! I apologize for my continued errors. I am still learning and making mistakes.
It seems I am having trouble accurately counting the cookies in the image.
Could you please tell me what answer you are getting? This will help me learn and improve.
I am committed to getting better at this!

ME

30

Gemini 1.5 Pro

Ah, I see where I went wrong!
I was counting the numbers as individual cookies, instead of realizing they represent the quantity in each column.
So, itâ€™s:
2 columns of cookies on the left 3 columns of cookies in the middle 5 columns of cookies on the right That makes a total of 30 cookies!
Thank you for helping me understand. I appreciate your patience as I learn and improve. I am starting to see how tricky image interpretation can be!

title: Super Bowl LVII Predictions using LLM
Comparing Temperature in LLMs
text:
In my CIS 3990, Introduction to Artificial Intelligence class, we learned about temperature in the AI models
We coded a small project where we compared difference in Temperature using both chatgpt API and Anthropic API.









%%capture  !pip install openai  !pip install anthropic  !pip install tiktoken 




from getpass import getpass  from openai import OpenAI  import os 


print(â€˜Enter OpenAI API key:â€™)  openai_api_key = getpass()  openai_client = OpenAI(api_key=openai_api_key) 



#Example showing effect of temperature   def generate_poem_with_temperature(temperature):  messages = [  {â€œroleâ€: â€œuserâ€, â€œcontentâ€: â€œGive me a haiku about swansâ€}  ] response = openai_client.chat.completions.create(  model=â€œgpt-4â€,  messages=messages,  max_tokens = 100,  temperature = temperature  ) completion = response.choices[0].message.content  print(completion + â€œâ€”â€)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 1 poems =====â€)  generate_poem_with_temperature(1)  generate_poem_with_temperature(1)  generate_poem_with_temperature(1)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 0 poems =====â€)  generate_poem_with_temperature(0)  generate_poem_with_temperature(0)  generate_poem_with_temperature(0)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 2 poems =====â€)  generate_poem_with_temperature(2)  generate_poem_with_temperature(2)  generate_poem_with_temperature(2) 

RESPONSE 
===== Temperature 1 poems =====  Swans grace the still lake, Their white forms pure poetry, Silent ballet wakes.  Graceful in still pond, White swans glide in tranquil dance, Beauty in silence.  White plumes on the lake, Swans dance with a gentle grace, Beauty in pure state. 
===== Temperature 0 poems ===== Swans glide on the lake, Elegance in every wake, Beauty in their wake. 
Swans glide on the lake, Elegance in every wake, Beauty in their wake.  Swans glide on the lake, Elegance in every wake, Beauty in their wake.

import anthropic   anthropic_api_key = getpass()  anthropic_client = anthropic.Anthropic(api_key=anthropic_api_key) 




#Example showing setting temperature on anthropic 


def anthropic_generate(messages, temperature, max_tokens=100, model = â€œclaude-3-haiku-20240307â€): response = anthropic_client.messages.create(  model=model,  messages=messages,  max_tokens = max_tokens,  temperature=temperature  ) completion = response.content[0].text  print(completion + â€œâ€”â€) 


print(â€œ===== Temperature 0.2 poems =====â€)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0.2)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0.2)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0.2)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 0 poems =====â€)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 1 poems =====â€)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=1)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=1)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=1) 



===== Temperature 0.2 poems =====  Here is a haiku about swans: 
Graceful swans glide by,  Elegant necks arched in flight,  Serene on the lake. 
Here is a haiku about swans:   Graceful swans glide by,  Elegant necks held high and proud,  Serene on the lake. 
 Here is a haiku about swans:   Graceful swans glide by,  Elegant necks arched in flight,  Serene on the lake.
===== Temperature 0 poems =====  Here is a haiku about swans:
Graceful swans glide by,ã€€ Elegant necks arched in flight,ã€€ Serene on the lake.ã€€
Here is a haiku about swans:ã€€
Graceful swans glide by, Elegant necks arched in flight, Serene on the lake.
Here is a haiku about swans:
Graceful swans glide by, Elegant necks arched in flight, Serene on the lake.
===== Temperature 1 poems ===== Here is a haiku about swans:
Graceful swans glide by, Elegant necks held high and proud, On the serene lake.
 Graceful swans gliding,ã€€ On tranquil waters they float, Elegant beauty.

title: Comparing Temperature in LLMs
text:

from getpass import getpass  from openai import OpenAI  import os 


print(â€˜Enter OpenAI API key:â€™)  openai_api_key = getpass()  openai_client = OpenAI(api_key=openai_api_key) 



#Example showing effect of temperature   def generate_poem_with_temperature(temperature):  messages = [  {â€œroleâ€: â€œuserâ€, â€œcontentâ€: â€œGive me a haiku about swansâ€}  ] response = openai_client.chat.completions.create(  model=â€œgpt-4â€,  messages=messages,  max_tokens = 100,  temperature = temperature  ) completion = response.choices[0].message.content  print(completion + â€œâ€”â€)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 1 poems =====â€)  generate_poem_with_temperature(1)  generate_poem_with_temperature(1)  generate_poem_with_temperature(1)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 0 poems =====â€)  generate_poem_with_temperature(0)  generate_poem_with_temperature(0)  generate_poem_with_temperature(0)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 2 poems =====â€)  generate_poem_with_temperature(2)  generate_poem_with_temperature(2)  generate_poem_with_temperature(2) 

RESPONSE

Swans glide on the lake, Elegance in every wake, Beauty in their wake.  Swans glide on the lake, Elegance in every wake, Beauty in their wake.

title: Comparing Temperature in LLMs
text:
import anthropic   anthropic_api_key = getpass()  anthropic_client = anthropic.Anthropic(api_key=anthropic_api_key) 




#Example showing setting temperature on anthropic 


def anthropic_generate(messages, temperature, max_tokens=100, model = â€œclaude-3-haiku-20240307â€): response = anthropic_client.messages.create(  model=model,  messages=messages,  max_tokens = max_tokens,  temperature=temperature  ) completion = response.content[0].text  print(completion + â€œâ€”â€) 


print(â€œ===== Temperature 0.2 poems =====â€)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0.2)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0.2)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0.2)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 0 poems =====â€)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=0)  print(â€œ===== Temperature 1 poems =====â€)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=1)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=1)  anthropic_generate(messages=messages, temperature=1) 



===== Temperature 0.2 poems =====  Here is a haiku about swans: 
Graceful swans glide by,  Elegant necks arched in flight,  Serene on the lake. 
Here is a haiku about swans:   Graceful swans glide by,  Elegant necks held high and proud,  Serene on the lake.
